conclusion: Understand the direction of the new light source relative to the objects and the surface.
Initial light source is positioned in front of the objects, causing shadows A, B, C, and D to be cast towards the back right.
When the light source moves to the back right, it will be positioned behind the objects from the viewer's perspective.
If the light comes from the back right, the shadows will move towards the front left (from the viewer's perspective).
Shadow A will move to the front left.
Shadow B will move to the front left, possibly closer to the object itself due to the angle change.
Shadow C will continue to fall towards the front left, potentially getting smaller as the angle reduces further.
Shadow D will change its position to the front left, likely becoming shorter due to the change in angles.
Depending on the distance between the light source and the objects, the shadows may appear slightly larger or smaller.
Generally, the shadows might get a bit smaller, but the primary change will be their direction.
Final Answer: A will move to the front left.
Final Answer: B will move to the front left, possibly closer to the object.
Final Answer: C will move to the front left, potentially becoming smaller.
Final Answer: D will move to the front left, possibly becoming smaller.
Assume that the light source moves directly to the back right without any other factors influencing the shadows.
